Name: Ambipur
Reason: Ambipur is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Ambipur products. Don't sell Ambipur products. Don't work for Ambipur.

Name: Ariel
Reason: Ariel is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Ariel products. Don't sell Ariel products. Don't work for Ariel.

Name: Bold
Reason: Bold is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Bold products. Don't sell Bold products. Don't work for Bold.

Name: Carrefour
Reason: Carrefour made huge investments into Israel last year, opening 50 stores and is planning to open a further 100 by 2024.
How to Boycott: Dont shop at Carrefour supermarkets. Don't work for Carrefour.

Name: Cif
Reason: Cif is owned by Unilever. Ben & Jerry's is also owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Cif products. Don't sell Cif products. Don't work for Unilever.

Name: Comfort
Reason: Comfort is owned by Unilever. Ben & Jerry's is also owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Comfort products. Don't sell Comfort products. Don't work for Unilever.

Name: Curver
Description: Resin and plastic household products such as baskets and containers.
Reason: The parent company of Curver operated facilities in the Occupied West Bank's Barkan Industrial Estate. After boycott pressure it seems to have closed the facility, however its history of complicity in the occupation means it should still be boycotted.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Curver products. Don't sell Curver products.
Alternatives: Any other brand products in the same category.

How to Boycott: Dont buy Domestos products. Don't sell Domestos products. Don't work for Unilever.

Reason: Febreze is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.

Name: Flash
Reason: Flash is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.

Name: Jo Malone
Description: Cosmetics company, owned by Estee Lauder.
Reason: Jo Malone is owned by Estee Lauder, who's ownership, especially Ronald Lauder, has extremist zionist views and financially and politically supports Israeli occupation of Palestinian land.
How to Boycott: Dont buy products from the vast catalogue of Estee Lauder. Brands include MAC cosmetics, Clinique, Bobbi Brown, Jo Malone, La Mer, Tom Ford Beauty and many more. Don't work for Estee Lauder brands.

Name: Keter
Description: Sheds, garden furniture and household products.
Reason: Keter operated facilities in the Occupied West Bank's Barkan Industrial Estate. After boycott pressure it seems to have closed the facility, however its history of complicity in the occupation means it should still be boycotted.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Keter products. Don't sell Keter products.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand alternatives. Non Keter products in same category.

Name: Lenor
Reason: Lenor is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Lenor products. Don't sell Lenor products. Don't work for Lenor.

Name: Pampers
Reason: Pampers are made in factories on occupied territory, and is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Pampers products. Don't sell Pampers products. Don't work for Pampers.

Name: Persil
Reason: Persil licence is owned by Unilever. Ben & Jerry's is also owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Persil products. Don't sell Persil products. Don't work for Unilever.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products. Eg. Aldi, Lidl.

Name: Power Action
Reason: Power Action wipes and other products are made in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Power Action products. Don't sell Power Action products. Pressure Home Bargains to stop stocking Power Action products.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand alternatives, eg. Aldi, Lidl.

Name: Procter & Gamble
Reason: Procter and Gamble opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy P&G products. Don't sell P&G products. Don't work for P&G.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products. Eg. Aldi, Lidl.

Name: SodaStream
Reason: SodaStream is an Israeli company which manufactured its products in Occupied Palestine. Now owned by Pepsico after a $3.2b acquisition. It since moved its factory from the West Bank to main Israel, however is still subject to boycott for its firing of 60 Palestinian workers and dark history.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Sodastream devices. Don't sell Sodastream devices.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products, eg. Aldi, Asda, Lidl. Saka water (from Turkiye). Barr Drinks (owner of Irn Bru).

Name: Surf
Reason: Surf licence is owned by Unilever. Ben & Jerry's is also owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Surf products. Don't sell Surf products. Don't work for Unilever.
